entry.et: Middle English, from Old English meolc, milc; akin to Old High German miluh milk, Old English melcan to milk emulsion

def.dt: :a fluid secreted by the mammary glands of females for the nourishment of their young
:cow's milk used as a food by humans
:lactation cows in milk
:a liquid resembling milk in appearance: as
:the latex of a plant
:the juice of a coconut composed of liquid endosperm
:the contents of an unripe kernel of grain
:to draw milk from the breasts or udder of
:suckle 2
:to draw (milk) from the breast or udder
:suckle 1 used of domestic animals
:to draw something from as if by milking: as
:to induce (a snake) to eject venom
:to draw or coerce profit or advantage from illicitly or to an extreme degree :exploit milk the joke for all it's worth
:to draw or yield milk
:giving milk
:bred or suitable primarily for milk production milk cows
river 625 miles (1006 kilometers) Canada & United States in Alberta & Montana flowing SE into Missouri River
:weak insipid
:chocolate made with milk solids
:butterfat
:a febrile disorder following parturition
:a disease of fresh cows, sheep, or goats that is caused by excessive drain on the body mineral reserves during the establishment of the milk flow
:an opaque and typically milky white glass used especially for novelty and ornamental objects
:a building for the cooling, handling, or bottling of milk
